intro: Rhynchospora gracilis, commonly known as slender beak sedge, is a flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in wet or marshy habitats, such as swamps and bogs. It has a rhizomatous root system that helps it spread and colonize new areas. Rhynchospora gracilis is often found in temperate regions of the northern hemisphere.
